text: LATAM Airlines Brazil () is Brazilian airline. LATAM was founded in 1961, but since 2000 it has grown fast. It's now the biggest airline in Brazil and all of Latin America. ==History== TAM Airlines began in 1961, with the name Taxi Aereo Marília (Marília Air Taxi). In 1971, one of the airline's pilots buys 33% of the airline's shares. In 1976, the pilot founds an airline with the name Transportes Aereos Regionais (Regional Air Transport). Both TAM and TAR Airlines were combined in 2000. This formed the TAM Airlines. In 2010, LAN Airlines and TAM Airlines were also combined. They formed the LATAM Airlines Group. ==Gallery== File:Fokker 100 (F-28-0100), TAM AN0287919.jpg|A TAM Fokker 100. The airline used to own 51 of these airplanes. File:TAM A340-500 PT-MSN FRA.jpg|A TAM Airbus A340 at Frankfurt Airport File:Voo TAM 3054 crash 2.jpg|The crash site of a TAM Airlines airplane in 2007. File:F-WZGU (PR-XTE 048) Airbus A350-941 Airbus Industrie (LATAM Airlines Brazil) TLS 16SEP16.jpg|Airbus A350-900 of LATAM Airlines Brazil File:Airbus A321-231, TAM AN2276109.jpg|Airbus A321-231 of TAM ==References== Category:Star Alliance Category:Airlines of Brazil Category:1961 establishments in Brazil
title: LATAM Airlines Brasil
